data.title: Film on UK television 2010 - BFI
data.text: ong>Filmong> on UK television 2010 UK ong>Filmong> Council Research and Statistics Unit 3 March 2011 In terms of audience numbers, the five terrestrial channels represent the most significant platform for film viewings in the UK, accounting for 51% of the televised feature film audience and 38% of all feature film viewings in the UK in 2009 1 . This report outlines the number of UK and foreign language film transmissions on the terrestrial channels in 2010. A total of 2,075 films were shown on the five main terrestrial channels in 2010, down 6% on 2009 (2,218 films). Channel 4 scheduled the most feature films (526) and BBC One the fewest (281), as Table 1 shows. One in five (21%) of all films broadcast were of UK origin, down slightly on 2009 (22%). Over one third (36%) of films shown on BBC Two and just over a quarter (26%) of ITV1â€™s film output was British. Almost 8% of films televised in 2010 were recent UK titles (ie released theatrically in the 8 years prior to TV broadcast). Almost 14% of films shown on BBC Two were recent UK productions, as were one in ten on BBC One and ITV1. Recent UK films broadcast on BBC One in 2010 included Wallace and Gromit: Curse of the Were-Rabbit, Flashbacks of a Fool, Breaking and Entering and The Flying Scotsman. Some of the highlights on BBC Two were The Damned United, In the Loop, Notes on a Scandal, The Other Boleyn Girl, Grow Your Own and Miss Potter. ITV1 screened Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Nanny McPhee, Elizabeth - The Golden Age and Hot Fuzz. Slumdog Millionaire, In Bruges, Looking for Eric, Stardust and This is England featured on Channel 4 over the year, while Five screened Outlaw, The Da Vinci Code and Layer Cake. Table 1 Feature films broadcast on terrestrial television, 2010 Channel Number of films broadcast Number of UK films broadcast UK film as % of total Number of recent* UK films broadcast Recent* UK as % of total film slots BBC One 281 43 15 28 10.0 BBC Two 364 130 36 50 13.7 ITV1 419 107 26 42 10.0 Channel 4 526 96 18 32 6.1 Five 485 58 12 8 1.6 Total 2,075 434 21 160 7.7 Source: Attentional, UK ong>Filmong> Council RSU analysis. *A recent film is one which has been theatrically released, or intended for theatrical release, in the UK since 2002. 1 UK ong>Filmong> Council Statistical Yearbook 2009/10. Audience figures for 2010 will appear in the forthcoming Statistical Yearbook 2010/11. 1
